meanings.definition: To reduce the amount or quantity of something
meanings.sent1: The drought will deplete our water supply quickly.
meanings.sent2: If we keep using the paper towels carelessly, we will deplete our stock in no time.
meanings.sent3: I didn't realize how much the game would deplete my energy levels!
meanings.sent4: Her constant demands seemed to deplete his patience like a leaky faucet.
meanings.sent5: The relentless sun seemed to deplete the land of all moisture, leaving it barren.

meanings.definition: To exhaust or use up a resource or supply
meanings.sent1: The long winter months deplete our firewood reserves.
meanings.sent2: The factory's production rate will deplete the raw materials sooner than expected.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guests managed to deplete our snack stash in record time!
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner felt as if each step was depleting his strength bit by bit.
meanings.sent5: The constant demands of work seemed to deplete her enthusiasm for the project.
